column2: and those who looked through it were said to see the withered or aged as whole and young again. It was even claimed to grant some power of healing to its wearer.<ref name="CG"/>
or at least the first of them

column4: but others say it was his pupil

column2: who gave it to her son [[Eärendil]]
column3: and with Eärendil it was carried across the Sea to the [[Aman|Blessed Realm]].<ref name="CG"/>
remade another version of the lost jewel with less power than the original
column4: in the [[Second Age]]. It was made as her behest
column5: pained at the state of [[Middle-earth]].<ref name="CG"/>

column2: [[Gandalf|Olórin]] brought back Earendil's jewel as a token from [[Yavanna]] that the [[Valar]] had not forsaken them; as [[Gandalf]]

column3: who in turn gave it to [[Arwen]]. <ref name="CG"/>

column2: the Elessar was the gift for [[Aragorn]]<Ref>{{FR|II8}}</ref>. This giving held the function of a wedding gift from the family of the bride to the groom

column2: and this causes him to also be given the name of '''King Elessar''' by the people of [[Minas Tirith]]. He adopted it as his royal name
